messages: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:07): Argh I am once again stymied by <dl>'s inconsiderate lack of <di>.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Will it do me any good to throw a request for <di> at you?  I can provide use-cases, all styling-related.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:08): can you make a convincing argument that the bug shouldn't be fixed in css rather than html? :-)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:08): ‚Ä¶probably not.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:11): Damn your logic!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:19): I wonder if anyone is going to propose an alternative to shelley's figure/dialog/dt/dd thing
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:20): I have it on my calendar.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:20): I can understand her aesthetic distaste for using <dt> and <dd> inside <figure>, but I can't say <fltcap> is much better
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:20): I'm considering making a proposal to use <label> instead
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:20): Despite <label>'s problems with embedded form elements?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:20): I can't say I love the status quo enough to ersonally advocate that
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:21): I won't be advocating the status quo either - I find the use of <dt>/<dd> to personally be ugly.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:21): yes, despite <label>'s potential problems for some use cases in current browsers
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:21): I guess I would probably have to suggest how future browsers could finesse the issue

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:22): I could go even more crazy and propose <label> for <details> and <caption> for <figure>, which is semantically the best match, but would require a parsing change for <figure> and could render it unusable in tables in the short term
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:22): er, a parsing change for <caption>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:22): I also wonder if there is a technical reason none of the <hn> elements would not do
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:23): One nice advantage of using <label> is that it suggests the possibility of putting the <label> outside of the <details> and linking it with an idref.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:23): Though perhaps that's bad for accessibility of the markup?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:24): I suggested using an <h1> for it on the list some time ago.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:24): I think a label where the details pop up somewhere else is actually useful in some cases
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:24): <label> makes it impossible to have form controls in a template-like page with a <figure>, so i think it's a non-starter
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:25): <h1> would interfere with the <figure> content model
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:25): What's the use-case for putting form controls in a figure caption?  I can't recall one right now.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:25): Editing, e.g. a checkbox in each figure for inclusion or exclusion of some sort

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:25): <label> would only have to create problems like that in the short term, which is still IMO better than <legend> was but to be fair is more objectively problematic than <dt>/<dd>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:26): <figure><legend><label>Caption: <input type=text></label></legend> ... </figure>
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:28): I see thee template use, then.  The hot-or-not use is weird, though.  We don't really want the form being outside of the page outline, do we?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:29): <figure> is an outline root, right?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:29): may be misremembering.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:32): <figure><dd><img src="random-photo-12345.jpg"></dd><dt><label><input type="radio" name="hotornot" value="hot">Hot</label> or <label><input type="radio" name="hotornot" value="not">Not</label></dt></figure>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:32): using current syntax
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:32): makes sense to me
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:33): I don't understand how the document outline would be relevant to whether those controls are part of the caption - certainly feels to me like they are

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:34): the way I would work around this if <figure>'s caption were <label> is to only let form controls inside a <figure> caption bind to a label through explicit <label for> or aria-labeledby and not implicitly via containment
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:34): that would make this use case for <figure> non-viable until all browsers update
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:36): i really think we should avoid making the platform that quirky
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:36): it's bad enough when we add quirks accidentally
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:37): no need to make it worse :-)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:41): it's true, that would be an odd quirk
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:41): and <label> is not a good enough match for <figure> to be worth fighting for
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:41): That would be way too strange.  It would confuse me.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:41): <caption> would be the best match
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:41): Let's all go back to <caption>.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:41): but the short-term cost of being unusable in tables might be too high
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:41): Man, who puts figures in tables?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:42): presumably that is what Flickr would do if they used <figure>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:43): we couldn't use <caption> at all -- you couldn't nest a figure in a <caption> if we used <caption>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:43): if we reuse elements, only <dt>/<dd> and <legend> make any sense, i believe
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:43): if we make a new element, well, we'd be adding to HTML's quite ridiculous set of "heading"-like elements
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:44): we're at 18 already iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:44): surely it's time to draw the line :-)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:44): Twitter's use of <table> doesn't even make *sense*.  They're a fixed-width site.  They can handle this in other ways.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:44): this far, no farther!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:44): s/Twitter/flickr/
40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278 (00:45): Let's draw the line at 20, just in case we eventually need one more... also, even numbers are better ^^
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:45): Why can't we nest <caption><figure><caption>?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:46): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: <caption> would close the parent <caption>
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:46): Damn legacy parsing constraints!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:46): I suppose that's a necessity for some reason.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:50): needs to write all this down.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:51): ‚Ä¶since he did offer to do that whole "Why Features Exist" thing.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I don't see why using <caption> would prevent you from nesting a <figure> in a <caption>, but I also don't see a use case for doing so
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:53): He said why while you were gone.  Legacy parsing constraint, apparently.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:53): <caption> has to imply </caption>

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:54): and as to why you'd have one in a table caption, putting <details> in a <caption> is one of the proposed ways of addressing the complex table accessibility issue

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:54): Is that necessary if the <caption> is nested inside a <figure>, though?  We *don't* have any legacy constraints surrounding people putting <figure> in table captions.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: does <caption> have to imply </caption> inside <figure>
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:54): doens't know if that complicates parsing or what.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:54): I don't see how that could be a legacy constraint
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:55): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: i really don't think adding a new parsing mode just to handle <figure> is the right balance to strike :-)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I think <label> would be better for <details> than <caption> and I think control nesting is not likely to be an issue there
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:56): It's not really an issue because the entirety of a details caption has to be active already.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:57): The *idea* of nesting form controls in a <details> caption is about as troublesome as nesting <a> inside of <a>, or <label> inside of <label> currently.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: i think <legend> would be orders of magnitude better than either of those
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:58): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: why? it's quite common
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:58): I've never done so on either, and it strikes me as crazy-talk.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:58): <legend> is broken for all uses in current browsers, as opposed to just in tables, so I can't see how it's worse than <caption> other than the fact that you have already written the spec for the needed parser chnges
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:58): er, can't see how it's better than <caption>

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:59): the <legend> parsing changes are a simplification. The <caption> parser changes are so much extra complexity they actually require at least one more parse mode.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:59): Firefox *can't* nest <label>s inside of <label>s.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:59): (possibly other's can't too)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:00): anyway, bbiab, gotta go to work

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (01:00): I think either possible change would be the about same amount of code change to WebKit's existing parser, regardless of whether it is a simplification or addition in the spec
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (01:00): gotta pay attention to meeting
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (01:00): back later
